decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining board advantage. Key cards like Dark Depths, Thespian's Stage, and Punishing Fire allow for quick removal and powerful combos. Life from the Loam and Gamble provide card advantage and consistency, while cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to outlast the opponent through resource denial and incremental advantage, ultimately overwhelming them with a powerful late-game presence.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and spells quickly to put pressure on the opponent. It utilizes cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to control the board while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Stifle and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of early aggression and control elements, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

The main strategy of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by using Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Counterbalance, and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of your library and counter your opponent's spells. Terminus and Swords to Plowshares are used to deal with creatures, while Monastery Mentor provides additional threats. The deck also includes card draw and interaction spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Force of Will to maintain card advantage and protect your game plan. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent color fixing.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then reanimating them onto the battlefield with Animate Dead, Exhume, and Reanimate. The key strategy is to bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Iona, Elesh Norn, and Tidespout Tyrant early in the game to overpower the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Misdirection to protect the combo and control the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on a combination of efficient creatures, disruption, and card advantage to control the board and pressure the opponent. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, alongside versatile creatures like Tarmogoyf and Baleful Strix, the deck is able to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting threats of its own. The inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Ancestral Vision further solidify the deck's ability to generate card advantage and tempo advantage. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and provide flexibility in casting powerful cards like Abrupt Decay and Force of Will.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent with countermagic like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to clear the way for its aggressive creatures. The deck aims to establish a fast clock and disrupt the opponent's game plan, utilizing a mix of tempo-oriented plays and card advantage to maintain momentum and close out games quickly.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the Aluren combo as quickly as possible. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Imperial Recruiter, the deck aims to cheat out creatures for free using Aluren's ability. This allows the player to generate value and create powerful board states. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a strong mix of creatures and spells, the deck aims to control the game and win through its powerful combo.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells while generating card advantage through Ancestral Vision and filtering with Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Abrupt Decay, while also pressuring the opponent with cards like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colors and provide the flexibility to cast a variety of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the pace of the game through the use of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By playing threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, while also utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to apply pressure while simultaneously disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main strategy of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Vryn Wingmare to slow down the opponent's spells, along with disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Meanwhile, efficient equipment like Batterskull and Swords of Fire and Ice provide additional threats and utility. The deck's mana denial plan is supported by cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, ensuring that the opponent struggles to establish their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful synergy and ramp potential of the Elf tribe to quickly generate mana and flood the board with creatures. By using cards like Gaea's Cradle, Green Sun's Zenith, and Natural Order, the deck aims to accelerate into massive creature plays, leading up to a game-winning finish with Craterhoof Behemoth. Glimpse of Nature provides card advantage while Nettle Sentinel, Wirewood Symbiote, and Quirion Ranger help maintain a steady flow of resources. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient combo strategy.

This deck focuses on using control elements to slowly grind down the opponent's resources while ramping up its own mana base. By utilizing lands like Glacial Chasm, The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, and Rishadan Port, it can disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own key pieces like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation provide flexibility and consistency in finding the right lands at the right time, while Punishing Fire serves as a removal option. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful land-based strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents while deploying efficient threats to apply pressure. Utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, along with disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board and dictate the pace of the game. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and flexible planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further disrupt opponents and provide additional win conditions. This deck excels at grinding out incremental advantages and out-valuing opponents.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide consistent card advantage. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Punishing Fire, along with disruptive cards such as Chalice of the Void and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to slow down the opponent while building up its own resources. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Life from the Loam to generate value by recurring lands and searching for key pieces like Dark Depths to create a powerful win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also includes disruption spells like Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will to control the game and protect its threats. The inclusion of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fire Covenant provide additional reach to finish off the opponent quickly. Overall, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to maintain control of the game by using powerful counter spells and removal to disrupt your opponent's plans while setting up your own win conditions with Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Monastery Mentor, and Entreat the Angels. The deck relies on card advantage and efficient card selection through cards like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top, while also using the Counterbalance/Top combo to lock opponents out of casting spells. The land base is designed to support a three-color control strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.
